title: Human Resource Executive Job at Derive Communications Systems & Engr. Ltd
content:
Derive Communications Systems & Engr. Ltd is a fully indigenously owned company incorporated in 2010 with physical offices in Abuja and Lagos; and operates nationwide. An expert company and specialist in providing Extra Low Voltage solutions such as electronic security solutions, fire safety protection systems, Data Networking, Network Security and Information technology solutions, Building Management System, Communications systems and renewable energy solutions; the company is recruiting a Human Resource Executive to join the team.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Executive

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Role
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Ensuring company culture is reflected throughout the employee lifecycle, enforcing the organization’s culture and adherence to the company’s code of conduct and external policies; carry out periodic surveys for improvement and stay up to date with information and best practices in Human Capital Management and Labor Law.
	Manage the recruitment process, including candidate sourcing, reference checks, and onboarding.
	Schedule and coordinate meetings, interviews, and HR events.
	Maintain and update employee databases regularly.
	Set-up, preparation, feedback and documentation of performance review exercises and appraisals, and employee development and annual training programs; conduct orientations, facilitate trainings programs as at when required that will improve employee productivity
	Maintain employee records and ensure compliance with HR policies.
	Support payroll processing by ensuring employee records are accurate and up to date.
	Drafting and implementing HR policies and procedures.
	Manage employee engagement initiatives to promote a positive work environment.
	Support performance management and training initiatives.
	Handle employee relations and workplace conflict resolution.
	Conducting performance review, management and employee evaluations.
	Maintain proper documentation and filing of HR-related records (both hard and soft copies).
	Coordinate employee exit processes, including exit interviews and clearance documentation.
	Maintain the work structure by conducting job analysis and updating job requirements for all positions to meet the requirements of the unit and achieve the objective of the organization
	Perform other role-related duties as may be assigned by the company.


Qualifications and Experience


	Minimum of a B.Sc Degree in Human Resource Management or related field.
	Minimum of 4 years of relevant experience working in a generalist HR environment.


Skills and Competencies:


	Ability to maintain and handle sensitive and confidential information.
	Broad knowledge and experience in employment law and HC practices.
	Excellent organizational and leadership skills
	Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills
	Diligent and firm with high ethical standards.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their updated CV and a one-page cover letter in a single document to: engineersdcsel@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted and should be ready for immediate interview.

title: Inventory Assistant Job at Maxitech Global Investment Limited
content:
Maxitech Global Investment Limited, a leading ICT distribution company, is recruiting a detail-oriented and organized candidate to join their team in the capacity below:

Job Position: Inventory Assistant

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing and maintaining the company’s inventory, ensuring accuracy, and supporting efficient operations.


Key Responsibilities
Inventory Management:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Monitor and maintain accurate records of inventory levels.
	Conduct regular stock counts and reconcile discrepancies.
	Ensure proper storage and organization of inventory items.


Stock Control:


	Track stock movements (receipts, issues, and returns).
	Monitor stock levels to prevent overstocking or stockouts.
	Coordinate with procurement and sales teams to ensure timely replenishment of stock.


Reporting:


	Prepare and submit daily, weekly, and monthly inventory reports.
	Analyze inventory data to identify trends and recommend improvements.
	Maintain up-to-date records of inventory transactions.


Quality Assurance:


	Inspect incoming goods for quality and quantity.
	Ensure damaged or defective items are reported and replaced promptly.


Process Improvement:


	Identify and implement strategies to optimize inventory management processes.
	Ensure compliance with company policies and procedures.


Team Collaboration:


	Work closely with the warehouse, procurement, and sales teams to ensure smooth operations.
	Provide support during audits and stock-taking exercises.


Qualifications and Requirements


	Education: Minimum of an HND/BSc in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, or a related field.
	Experience: At least 2 years of experience in inventory management, preferably in an ICT distribution or retail environment.


Skills:


	Proficient in inventory management software and Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word).
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent organizational and time management abilities.
	Attention to detail and accuracy.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.


Attributes:


	Honest, reliable, and proactive.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Willingness to work in a fast-paced environment.


Benefits


	Salary: N150,000 - N200,000 / Month.
	Opportunities for professional growth and development.
	A supportive and collaborative work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: olamilekan.sule@maxitechglobal.com using “Inventory Assistant Application" as the subject of the mail.
